title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hebrews chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hebrews Chapter 10.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:1, what does the law have a shadow of?
questions.correctAnswer: Good things to come
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:1 states that the law has a shadow of good things to come, not the very image of them.

questions.question: Why did the sacrifices continue to be offered year by year, according to Hebrews 10:2?
options: Because the worshippers still had a conscience of sins
Because they were pleasing to God
questions.correctAnswer: Because the worshippers still had a conscience of sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:2 explains that the sacrifices continued because the worshippers still had a conscience of sins.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 10:4 says that the blood of bulls and goats can take away sins.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:4 clearly states that it is not possible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.

questions.question: What did God prepare according to Hebrews 10:5?
questions.correctAnswer: A body
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:5 says God prepared a body when He came into the world.

questions.question: Who is described as having offered one sacrifice for sins forever in Hebrews 10:12?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:12 refers to Jesus Christ offering one sacrifice for sins forever.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:14, what has been perfected forever by one offering?
questions.correctAnswer: Those that are sanctified
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:14 teaches that by one offering He perfected forever those who are sanctified.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10:16 say God will put into the hearts and minds of people?
questions.correctAnswer: His laws
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:16 states that God will put His laws into their hearts and write them in their minds.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hebrews 10:19: 'Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the ______ by the blood of Jesus.'
questions.correctAnswer: holiest
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:19 says we have boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus.

questions.question: What is described as a 'new and living way' in Hebrews 10:20?
options: The way through the veil, his flesh
The sacrifices of bulls and goats
questions.correctAnswer: The way through the veil, his flesh
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:20 describes the new and living way as one consecrated through the veil, which is his flesh.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 10:23 encourages believers to hold fast to their faith without wavering.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:23 instructs believers to hold fast the profession of their faith without wavering.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:25, what should believers not forsake?
questions.correctAnswer: The assembling of themselves together
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:25 advises believers not to forsake the assembling of themselves together.

questions.question: What happens if someone sins willfully after receiving the knowledge of the truth, according to Hebrews 10:26?
options: There remains no more sacrifice for sins
questions.correctAnswer: There remains no more sacrifice for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:26 states that if we sin willfully after knowing the truth, no more sacrifice for sins remains.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 10:31 says it is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:31 describes falling into the hands of the living God as a fearful thing.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:35, what should believers not cast away?
questions.correctAnswer: Their confidence
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:35 urges believers not to cast away their confidence which has a great reward.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10:37 say about 'he that shall come'?
options: He will come and will not tarry
He will come only to some
He will come with many sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: He will come and will not tarry
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:37 promises that he who shall come will come and will not delay.

medium.title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hebrews Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about the effectiveness of repeated sacrifices for sin. Based on Hebrews 10, what biblical truth would you share about the sacrifice of Jesus?
options: Jesus offered one sacrifice for sins forever, perfecting those sanctified
Sacrifices must be offered daily to cover sins
The blood of bulls and goats can take away sins
The law's sacrifices make worshippers perfect
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus offered one sacrifice for sins forever, perfecting those sanctified
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:11-14 teaches that the repeated sacrifices offered by priests could never take away sins, but Jesus offered one sacrifice for sins forever and perfected those who are sanctified.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 10 encourage believers to approach God with confidence?
options: By entering the holiest by the blood of Jesus with a true heart and full assurance of faith
By strictly following the law's sacrifices
By relying on their own righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: By entering the holiest by the blood of Jesus with a true heart and full assurance of faith
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:19-22 instructs believers to draw near to God with a true heart and full assurance of faith, made possible through Jesus’ blood and a new living way.

questions.question: A Christian is feeling isolated and discouraged from attending church gatherings. What counsel from Hebrews 10 would you share about fellowship?
options: Do not forsake assembling together, but encourage one another
Fellowship is optional for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Do not forsake assembling together, but encourage one another
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:24-25 encourages believers not to neglect meeting together but to exhort and encourage one another, especially as the day of Christ's return approaches.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10 teach about perseverance when facing trials and afflictions?
options: Endure with patience and hold fast your confidence for a great reward
Give up when trials become severe
Rely only on your own strength
Avoid suffering by withdrawing from faith
questions.correctAnswer: Endure with patience and hold fast your confidence for a great reward
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:32-36 encourages believers to remember past endurance through affliction, maintain confidence, and patiently continue so they may receive God's promise.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 10 describe the new covenant God has made with believers?
options: God will put His laws into their hearts and will remember their sins no more
It is based on external rituals alone
It demands keeping the law without grace
questions.correctAnswer: God will put His laws into their hearts and will remember their sins no more
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:16-17 explains the new covenant where God writes His laws on believers' hearts and minds and no longer remembers their sins and iniquities.

questions.question: What warning does Hebrews 10 give about willful sin after receiving the knowledge of the truth?
options: There remains no more sacrifice for sins and fearful judgment awaits
Sin can be overlooked if repented later
questions.correctAnswer: There remains no more sacrifice for sins and fearful judgment awaits
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:26-27 warns that willful sin after knowing the truth leaves no more sacrifice for sins and leads to fearful judgment and fiery indignation.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10, what attitude should believers have toward their faith in light of God’s promises?
options: Hold fast the profession of faith without wavering because God is faithful
Depend on human wisdom to interpret promises
Delay obedience until all is clear
questions.correctAnswer: Hold fast the profession of faith without wavering because God is faithful
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:23 encourages believers to hold firmly to their faith without wavering, trusting that God who promised is faithful.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to love and serve others in the church. What practical encouragement does Hebrews 10 provide?
options: Consider one another to provoke to love and good works
Focus only on personal spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Consider one another to provoke to love and good works
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:24 exhorts believers to be mindful of one another and encourage love and good deeds within the community.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 10 teaches that the blood of bulls and goats is sufficient to take away sins.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:4 clearly states that it is not possible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins, highlighting the necessity of Christ's sacrifice.

questions.question: True or False: According to Hebrews 10, believers can have boldness to enter the holiest place because of Jesus’ sacrifice.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:19-20 affirms that believers have boldness to enter the holiest by the blood of Jesus, through a new and living way He consecrated.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hebrews 10 teaches us that we should hold fast the ______ of our faith without wavering, because God is faithful.
questions.correctAnswer: profession
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:23 instructs believers to hold fast the profession of their faith without wavering, relying on God's faithfulness.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 10 describe the priestly work of Jesus compared to the daily offerings of earthly priests?
options: Jesus offered one sacrifice for sins forever and then sat down at God's right hand
Jesus offers sacrifices daily like earthly priests
Earthly priests’ sacrifices are more effective
Jesus continues to sacrifice animals yearly
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus offered one sacrifice for sins forever and then sat down at God's right hand
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:11-12 contrasts earthly priests who offer sacrifices daily with Jesus who offered one sacrifice forever and sat down at God's right hand.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10 say about the conscience of worshippers under the old covenant sacrifices?
options: They still had a conscience of sins because sacrifices reminded them annually
They had no need for forgiveness
Their sins were taken away permanently
questions.correctAnswer: They still had a conscience of sins because sacrifices reminded them annually
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:2-3 explains that the sacrifices offered year by year remind worshippers of sins, so their conscience was not fully cleansed.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10, what should encourage believers to be patient and endure in doing God's will?
options: To receive the promise God has made
To avoid suffering at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: To receive the promise God has made
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:36 states that patience is needed to do God's will so that believers may receive His promised blessings.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 10 portray the consequences of despising the Son of God and trampling the blood of the covenant?
options: Such a person deserves a sorer punishment than those who rejected Moses’ law
There is no consequence if forgiven later
It is less serious than rejecting the law
It leads to immediate earthly success
questions.correctAnswer: Such a person deserves a sorer punishment than those who rejected Moses’ law
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:28-29 states that despising the Son of God and His blood warrants a far greater punishment than rejecting Moses’ law.

hard.title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hebrews Chapter 10.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10, why can the law's sacrifices never make the worshippers perfect?
options: Because they are a shadow of good things to come, not the very image
Because the sacrifices are too infrequent
Because the people do not believe
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are a shadow of good things to come, not the very image
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:1 explains that the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image, cannot with those sacrifices make perfect the comers thereunto.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "By one offering he hath ______ for ever them that are sanctified."
questions.correctAnswer: perfected
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:14 states that by one offering, Jesus has perfected forever those who are sanctified.

questions.question: What new covenant promise is mentioned in Hebrews 10, which refers back to the Old Testament?
options: God will put His laws into their hearts and write them in their minds
God will provide a physical temple for all nations
God will send prophets to judge sin
God will bring back the sacrificial system permanently
questions.correctAnswer: God will put His laws into their hearts and write them in their minds
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:16 quotes Jeremiah 31:33 about God putting His laws into hearts and minds, indicating the new covenant.

questions.question: Which Old Testament prophet is indirectly referenced in Hebrews 10:7 and 10:16 regarding doing God's will and the new covenant?
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:16 references the new covenant promise from Jeremiah 31:33, and 10:7 alludes to Psalm 40:7-8 which is messianic but Jeremiah is key for the new covenant.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 10 teaches that the blood of bulls and goats can take away sins.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:4 clearly states that it is not possible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.

questions.question: What does the author of Hebrews say Jesus did after offering one sacrifice for sins?
options: Sat down at the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: Sat down at the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:12 states that after offering one sacrifice for sins forever, Jesus sat down at the right hand of God.

questions.question: Which theme does Hebrews 10 emphasize about Jesus’ sacrifice in contrast to the repeated sacrifices under the law?
options: Jesus’ sacrifice is once for all and perfects the sanctified
Jesus’ sacrifice is symbolic and temporary
Jesus’ sacrifice must be repeated yearly
Jesus’ sacrifice requires human works to complete
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ sacrifice is once for all and perfects the sanctified
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:10 and 10:14 emphasize that Jesus’ sacrifice is once for all and perfects those sanctified, unlike repeated animal sacrifices.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10, what is the 'new and living way' consecrated for us through Jesus?
options: The way through the veil, that is to say, his flesh
The way of strict observance of the law
questions.correctAnswer: The way through the veil, that is to say, his flesh
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:20 describes the new and living way consecrated through the veil, meaning Jesus’ flesh, symbolizing access to God.

questions.question: What is the significance of the author encouraging believers to 'hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering' in Hebrews 10:23?
options: Because God is faithful to His promise
Because human effort is sufficient for salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Because God is faithful to His promise
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:23 urges believers to hold fast because God is faithful that promised, highlighting divine faithfulness as motivation.

questions.question: What warning does Hebrews 10 give about sinning willfully after receiving knowledge of the truth?
options: There remains no more sacrifice for sins
They will receive forgiveness upon repentance
They will be given more sacrifices to perform
questions.correctAnswer: There remains no more sacrifice for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:26 warns that if one sins willfully after receiving the truth, no more sacrifice for sins remains.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 10 depict the judgment for those who despise the Son of God and count the blood of the covenant unholy?
options: They will face sorer punishment than those who despised Moses' law
They will be forgiven if they repent
They will be given a second chance
They will be immediately welcomed back
questions.correctAnswer: They will face sorer punishment than those who despised Moses' law
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:29 compares the punishment for despising the Son of God as much sorer than that for despising Moses’ law.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10:31 say about falling into the hands of the living God?
questions.correctAnswer: It is a fearful thing
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:31 states explicitly that it is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God, emphasizing divine judgment.

questions.question: In Hebrews 10, what reason is given for believers not to forsake assembling together?
options: Because they should exhort one another and see the day approaching
Because the law requires weekly gatherings
Because it is a tradition from Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Because they should exhort one another and see the day approaching
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:25 advises not forsaking assembly so that believers can exhort one another, especially as the day of judgment approaches.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience' in Hebrews 10:22 symbolize?
questions.correctAnswer: Purification and cleansing through faith
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:22 uses the imagery of sprinkling and washing to symbolize spiritual purification and cleansing from sin by faith.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 10 encourage believers to respond to afflictions and persecutions they have endured?
options: By remembering their past endurance and joyfully accepting loss for a heavenly reward
By withdrawing from the faith community
questions.correctAnswer: By remembering their past endurance and joyfully accepting loss for a heavenly reward
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:32-34 recounts believers’ endurance of afflictions and joy in suffering, knowing they have a better and enduring substance in heaven.

theological.title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hebrews Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:1, why can the law with its yearly sacrifices never make the worshippers perfect?
options: Because it is only a shadow of good things to come, not the very image
Because the sacrifices were not offered often enough
questions.correctAnswer: Because it is only a shadow of good things to come, not the very image
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:1 teaches that the law is a shadow of good things to come and not the exact image, so its sacrifices cannot perfect the worshippers. This aligns with Colossians 2:17 and Romans 8:3, which emphasize the temporary nature of the law and its shadows compared to Christ's reality.

questions.question: What is said in Hebrews 10:4 about the blood of bulls and goats?
questions.correctAnswer: It cannot take away sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:4 clearly states that the blood of bulls and goats cannot take away sins, highlighting the insufficiency of animal sacrifices. This is consistent with Leviticus 17:11, Isaiah 53:5, and 1 John 1:7, which point to the necessity of Christ's sacrifice for true forgiveness.

questions.question: In Hebrews 10:5, what does Christ say was prepared for Him instead of sacrifice and offering?
questions.correctAnswer: A body
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:5 quotes Psalm 40:6-8, indicating that God prepared a body for Christ to fulfill God's will rather than animal sacrifices. This affirms the incarnation and obedience of Christ (John 1:14; Philippians 2:7-8; Isaiah 53:10).

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10:10 say sanctifies believers?
options: The offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all
The continual sacrifices of the law
questions.correctAnswer: The offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:10 teaches that believers are sanctified by Christ’s once-for-all offering of His body, emphasizing the sufficiency and finality of His sacrifice. This is consistent with Ephesians 5:26, 1 Corinthians 6:11, and Hebrews 9:14.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:12, what did Christ do after offering one sacrifice for sins forever?
options: Sat down at the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: Sat down at the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:12 states that after offering one sacrifice for sins, Christ sat down at God's right hand, signifying the completion and acceptance of His work (Psalm 110:1; Mark 16:19; Acts 7:55-56; Romans 8:34).

questions.question: What promise is given in Hebrews 10:16 regarding the new covenant?
options: God will put His laws into their hearts and write them on their minds
God will require animal sacrifices again
God will send an earthly king
questions.correctAnswer: God will put His laws into their hearts and write them on their minds
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:16 quotes Jeremiah 31:33 about God’s new covenant, promising internal transformation through the Spirit, which is echoed in Ezekiel 36:26-27 and Romans 2:15.

questions.question: What confidence do believers have according to Hebrews 10:19?
options: Boldness to enter the holiest by the blood of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Boldness to enter the holiest by the blood of Jesus
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:19 declares believers have boldness to enter the holiest place by Jesus’ blood, symbolizing direct access to God, consistent with Ephesians 2:18 and Romans 5:1-2.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:20, what is described as the 'new and living way' consecrated for us?
questions.correctAnswer: His flesh, through the veil
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:20 refers to Christ’s flesh as the veil that consecrates a new and living way, emphasizing the new access to God through Christ’s sacrifice (Matthew 27:51; John 14:6; 2 Corinthians 5:21).

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10:23 urge believers to do regarding their faith?
options: Hold fast the profession of faith without wavering
questions.correctAnswer: Hold fast the profession of faith without wavering
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:23 exhorts believers to hold firmly to their faith because God is faithful to His promises, aligning with 1 Corinthians 15:58, Philippians 1:27, and 2 Timothy 4:7.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 10:25, what should believers not neglect?
questions.correctAnswer: The assembling of themselves together
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:25 commands believers not to forsake meeting together but to encourage one another, highlighting the importance of Christian community and mutual support (Acts 2:42; 1 Corinthians 12:12-27; Ephesians 4:11-13).

questions.question: What consequence does Hebrews 10:26 warn about sinning willfully after receiving knowledge of the truth?
options: There remains no more sacrifice for sins
questions.correctAnswer: There remains no more sacrifice for sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:26 warns that willful sin after knowing the truth leaves no further sacrifice for sins, underscoring the seriousness of apostasy (Numbers 15:30; John 15:6; 2 Peter 2:20-22).

questions.question: What is described as a fearful expectation in Hebrews 10:27?
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment and fiery indignation
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:27 describes fearful expectation of judgment and fiery indignation for adversaries, consistent with Revelation 20:11-15 and 2 Thessalonians 1:7-9.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 10:29 say about one who has trodden under foot the Son of God and counted the blood of the covenant unholy?
options: They are worthy of sorer punishment
questions.correctAnswer: They are worthy of sorer punishment
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:29 warns that despising Christ’s sacrifice and the Spirit of grace leads to a punishment worse than that under Moses’ law, echoing passages like Matthew 12:31-32 and Luke 12:47-48.

questions.question: In Hebrews 10:31, what is said about falling into the hands of the living God?
questions.correctAnswer: It is a fearful thing
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:31 states it is fearful to fall into God’s hands, reflecting the reverence and awe due to divine judgment (Deuteronomy 32:35; Romans 11:22; Job 1:21).

questions.question: What encouragement does Hebrews 10:35 give to believers regarding their confidence?
options: Do not cast away your confidence, it has great recompense of reward
questions.correctAnswer: Do not cast away your confidence, it has great recompense of reward
questions.explanation: Hebrews 10:35 encourages believers to maintain confidence as it will be richly rewarded, consistent with Proverbs 3:26, 2 Timothy 4:7-8, and James 1:12.
